item.description:
Venture Café and Django Meetup
* 6pm-7pm, Networking at the Venture Café
Django Meetup
* 7pm, Talk, Mike Axiak
* 7:20pm, Talk, Jonathan Stiebel

The Venture Café
The Venture Café, currently in its alpha stage, is a resource for the Boston entrepreneurial and innovation communities with the mission of creating fresh and useful conversations. As the Venture Cafe prepares to enter into its permanent home in Kendall Square, the founders project that the marriage of innovation and creativity with a European-style cafe space will facilitate collaboration and build a greater sense of community in Kendall Square. www.venturecafe.net
For more information, contact:
Carrie Stalder, Founding Manager for The Venture Café
617-329-1324, carrie@venturecafe.net

Using Bloom filters in Django applications
Mike Axiak
Everyone's toolbox contains dictionaries and regular expressions for doing text processing, but what if they aren't enough? We'll look at one example of a problem that lends itself to Bloom filters and how to integrate it into a Django app.

Open Source Marketing Platform
Jonathan Stiebel
In this session, I will show you how I used Pinax (a "ready-to-use" platform) on top of the Django platform to create an open source marketing platform in Python. This provides a landing page for collecting email addresses, a responder that encourages people to confirm their email address, and lets them know they are subscribed. Recently I expanded it to allow for many targeted squeeze pages, and email follow-ups, for a single website. Existing commercial solutions change on a per list basis.
The source code of two applications will be presented implemented using this platform. Please be prepared to offer suggestions for how to extend this project. I am seeking collaborators on this open source project.
item.name: Django Boston Oct 2010
